Title: Clinical handover
Content: Clinical handover or handover is the transfer of professional responsibility and accountability for some or all aspects of care for a patient or group of patients to another person or professional group on a temporary or permanent basis. When critical clinical information emerges or there is a risk to patient care timely communication of this information to the appropriate persons is essential to ensuring patient safety and delivery of the right care. Australia the United Kingdom and other countries have developed risk reduction recommendations.
